definition: to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt

sentences.english: Moscow has pulled a fast one on us by breaking its word on troop withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科耍了我们一票，撤军的事不认账了。

definition: to refuse to admit (what one has done)/to disavow/to renege
undisclosed account/to settle matters later/to blame sb after the event
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative)/to accept (a version of events)/to buy it
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to use all sorts of excuses
to fall out with sb and become hostile
